run id.short_description: yaml file that specifies error codes for files
run id.long_description: Explanation of all files which are expected to be empty due to a failed/missing module.

run id.short_description: copynumber: Sequenza CNV segments file
run id.long_description: Copy number variation segments file called by the Sequenza software package.  The column descriptions for the segment file could be found here (https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/sequenza/vignettes/sequenza.html#plots-and-results)

run id.short_description: copynumber: Sequenza genome-wide plot of depth.ratio and B-allele frequency.
run id.long_description: Genome-wide plot (generated by Sequenza) showing depth.ratio and B-allele frequency.

run id.short_description: copynumber: Sequenza plot of depth.ratio and B-allele frequency chromosome by chromosome.
run id.long_description: Chromosome by chromosome plot (generated by Sequenza) showing depth.ratio and B-allele frequency.

run id.short_description: copynumber: Sequenza CNV segments file filtered with hard cut-offs to call regions of GAIN/LOSS
run id.long_description: Filtered Sequenza segments file after applying a hard cut-off to call regions of GAIN (total copy number >= 3) and regions of LOSS (total copy number <= 1.5).

run id.short_description: copynumber: Sequenza post-processed seqz file used for input to Sequenza CNV caller
run id.long_description: Sequenza seqz file generated by the bam2seqz software using a GC wiggle track with a window size of 50 (-w 50).

run id.short_description: purity: Sequenza Cellularity and Ploidy estimate file
run id.long_description: Cellularity and ploidy estimates of the tumor sample using the Sequenza software package.  The columns of the file are follows: Cellularity, Ploidy, and SLPP (Scaled Log Posterior Probability).

run id.short_description: purity: Sequenza plot of likelihood densities for all cellularity/ploidy solutions.
run id.long_description: Sequenza generated plot showing the likelihood densities for each cellularity/ploidy solution (https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/sequenza/vignettes/sequenza.html#plots-and-results).

run id.short_description: tumor clonality: PyClone-VI input file generated by sequenza library (https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/sequenza/index.html)
run id.long_description: Input file generated for PyClone-VI analysis.  Sequenza was used to generate the expected file format (https://github.com/Roth-Lab/pyclone-vi#input-format).

run id.short_description: tumor clonality: PyClone-VI tumor clonality results file
run id.long_description: Tumor clone/cluster prevalence estimations generated by the PyClone-VI software package.  The format of the results file is described here (https://github.com/Roth-Lab/pyclone-vi#output-format).

run id.short_description: tumor clonality: PyClone-VI tumor clonality results summary file
run id.long_description: Summary of Pyclone-VI results file condensed to only show the cluster_id, cellular_prevalence, and cellular_prevalence_std columns.

run id.short_description: copynumber: CNVkit segments file
run id.long_description: CNVkit's Segmented log2 ratios file. The 'cn' column representes the total copy number of the segment.  The other columns of the results file are described here (https://cnvkit.readthedocs.io/en/stable/fileformats.html#segmented-log2-ratios-cns)

run id.short_description: copynumber: Enhanced CNVkit segments file with BAF and Major/minor allele information
run id.long_description: The enhanced CNVkit segments file incoporates somatic sNP and tumor purity information (called by the pipeline) to incorporate B-allele frequencies, major and minor allele (cn1 and cn2 respectively), and correct for tumor sample purity level.

run id.short_description: copynumber: scatter plot of log2 coverage and segmentation call information
run id.long_description: Genome-wide scatter plot of log2 coverage ratios and called CNV segments

run id.short_description: copynumber: CNVkit segments file filtered with hard cut-offs to call regions of GAIN/LOSS
run id.long_description: Filtered CNVkit segments file after applying a hard cut-off to call regions of GAIN (total copy number >= 3) and regions of LOSS (total copy number <= 1.5).

run id.short_description: copynumber: Consensus CNV segments file
run id.long_description: Consensus CNV regions that are called by at least 2 of the 3 callers (CNVkit, Sequenza, or FACETS).  CNV Callers must agree on both the region (intersection of overlapped regions) and the call (GAIN or LOSS).

run id.short_description: copynumber: Consensus CNV segments file of only GAIN regions
run id.long_description: GAIN only CNV regions derived from the consensus CNV file.  Regions are also merged if they have an overlap of at least 1bp.

run id.short_description: copynumber: Consensus CNV segments file of only LOSS regions
run id.long_description: LOSS only CNV regions derived from the consensus CNV file.  Regions are also merged if they have an overlap of at least 1bp.

run id.short_description: msisensor2: microsatellite instability calculation
run id.long_description: Microsatellite instability calculation using msisensor2 (https://github.com/niu-lab/msisensor2)

run id.short_description: neaontigen: list of predicted neoantigens
run id.long_description: The combined MHC class I and II predicted neoantigens using the pVACseq software.  The column definitions are given here (ref: https://pvactools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/pvacseq/output_files.html)

run id.short_description: tumor purity: tumor purity estimates using the FACETS software package
run id.long_description: Tumor purity estimates using the FACETS software (https://github.com/mskcc/facets).

run id.short_description: copynumber: FACETS CNV segments file
run id.long_description: Copy number variation segments file called by the FACETS software (https://github.com/mskcc/facets).

run id.short_description: copynumber: FACETS CNV segments file filtered with hard-cutoff to call regions of GAIN/LOSS
run id.long_description: Filtered FACETS segments file after applying a hard cut-off to call regions of GAIN (total copy number >= 3) and regions of LOSS (total copy number <= 1.5).

run id.short_description: wes report: wes summary html report
run id.long_description: This is a gzipped file of the report directory, which contains the report.html file.  After unzipping the file, the user can load report/report.html into any browser to view the WES Summary Report.  The report contains run information (i.e. wes software version used to run the analysis as well as the software version of the major tools) as well as summarizations of sample quality, copy number variation, somatic variants, and HLA-type/neoantigen predictions.

run id.short_description: somatic variants: report file of tumor vs germline variants overlap
run id.long_description: This file derived from the somatic and germline variants comparison results generated by vcf-compare (http://vcftools.sourceforge.net/perl_module.html#vcf-compare) and is formatted to be human readable.  The file reports the number of somatic/tumor only variants (unfiltered), germline/normal only variants (unfiltered), the number of shared variants, and the percent overlap (using the total number of somatic variants as the denominator).

run id.short_description: wes pipeline version- INTERNAL ONLY- for reproducibility
run id.long_description: wes pipeline version- INTERNAL ONLY- for reproducibility

run id.short_description: wes pipeline config file- INTERNAL ONLY- for reproducibility
run id.long_description: wes pipeline config file- INTERNAL ONLY- for reproducibility

run id.short_description: wes pipeline metasheet file- INTERNAL ONLY- for reproducibility
run id.long_description: wes pipeline metasheet file- INTERNAL ONLY- for reproducibility

run id.short_description: wes sample json for cohort report generation-INTERNAL ONLY
run id.long_description: wes sample json for cohort report generation-INTERNAL ONLY

run id.short_description: rna: Variants called from RNA-seq data
run id.long_description: RNA-seq variants called using the Sentieon RNA Variant Calling pipeline(https://support.sentieon.com/manual/RNA_call/rna/).  Sentieon's Haplotyper algorithm was used for the variant calling.

run id.short_description: rna: Shared RNA and WES variants that is used for neoantigen prediction when RNA-seq data is provided with the WES run
run id.long_description: Variants file representing the common variants between RNA (haplotyper.rna.vcf.gz) and WES data (output.twist.neoantigen.vep.vcf).

run id.short_description: somatic variants: vcf file of somatic variants
run id.long_description:
VCF file of somatic variants using one of the following the Sentieon somatic callers {tnscope (default), tnhaplotyper2, tnsnv}.

TNscope algorithm- https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#tnscope-algorithm
TNhaplotyper2- https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#tnhaplotyper2-algorithm
TNsnv - https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#tnsnv-algorithm

run id.short_description: somatic variants: vcf file of somatic variants in TWIST targed capture region
run id.long_description: VCF file of variants that fall within the TWIST excome capture regions.  bcftools is used to filter reads in output.vcf.gz that intersect with the TWIST capture regions.

run id.short_description: somatic variants: maf file of somatic variants in TWIST targed capture region
run id.long_description: MAF file of variants that fall within the TWIST excome capture regions generated using vcf2maf tool (https://github.com/mskcc/vcf2maf). VEP was used to annotate twist.vcf file, which was then used as input to vcf2maf.  NOTE: Some columns in this maf file may be affected by the ExACdb assembly compatibility issue discussed in the WES pipeline overview page (https://portal.cimac-network.org/pipelines/wes).

run id.short_description: somatic variants: vcf file of somatic variants in TWIST targed capture region filtered by PASS column
run id.long_description: VCF file of variants that fall within the TWIST excome capture regions filtered to remove vairants where the PASS column contained one of the following- germline-risk, low_t_alt_frac, t_lod_fstar, or triallelic_site

run id.short_description: somatic variants: maf file of somatic variants in TWIST targed capture region filtered by PASS column
run id.long_description: MAF file generated by converting twist.filtered.vcf to maf using VEP to annotate variants and vcf2maf to do the conversion.  NOTE: Some columns in this maf file may be affected by the ExACdb assembly compatibility issue discussed in the WES pipeline overview page (https://portal.cimac-network.org/pipelines/wes).

run id.short_description: tcell: TCell fraction estimates generated by TcellExTRECT
run id.long_description: TCell fraction estimates generated by the TcellExTRECT software (https://github.com/McGranahanLab/TcellExTRECT)

normal cimac id.short_description: alignment: bam file with deduplicated reads
normal cimac id.long_description: Aligned reads were sorted and marked duplicates were removed using the Sentieon Dedup tool (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#dedup-algorithm)

normal cimac id.short_description: alignment: index file for deduplicated bam
normal cimac id.long_description: Bam index file for deduplicated bam file generated by the Sentieon Dedup tool (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#dedup-algorithm)

normal cimac id.short_description: alignment: Base Qualtiy Score Recalibration (BQSR) bam file
normal cimac id.long_description: The Sentieon QualCal (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#qualcal-algorithm) is used to perform BSQR and remove any technical artifacts in the base quality scores.

normal cimac id.short_description: alignment: index file for Base Qualtiy Score Recalibration (BQSR) bam file
normal cimac id.long_description: Index file for the BQSR bam file
Haplotype variants using Sentieon Haplotyper algorithm (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#haplotyper-algorithm)

normal cimac id.short_description: germline: vcf of haplotype variants in targeted regions
normal cimac id.long_description: Haplotype variants within targeted capture regions using Sentieon Haplotyper algorithm (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#haplotyper-algorithm)

normal cimac id.short_description: hla: MHC Class I and II results (using HLA-HD)
normal cimac id.long_description: Predicted MHC Class II and II results using the HLA-HD software (https://www.genome.med.kyoto-u.ac.jp/HLA-HD/).  Chromosome 6 reads from the deduplicated bam file were extracted and fed into the HLA-HD prediction algorithm.

normal cimac id.short_description: hla: MHC Class I results (using OptiType)
normal cimac id.long_description: Predicted MHC Class I alleles using the Optitype software (https://github.com/FRED-2/OptiType).  Chromosome 6 reads from the deduplicated bam file were extracted and fed into the Optitype prediction algorithm.

normal cimac id.short_description: hla: MHC Class I and II results (using xhla)
normal cimac id.long_description: Predicted MHC Class I and II results using the xHLA software(https://github.com/humanlongevity/HLA).  Chromosome 6 reads from the deduplicated bam file were extracted and fed into the xHLA prediction algorithm.

tumor cimac id.short_description: alignment: bam file with deduplicated reads
tumor cimac id.long_description: Aligned reads were sorted and marked duplicates were removed using the Sentieon Dedup tool (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#dedup-algorithm)

tumor cimac id.short_description: alignment: index file for deduplicated bam
tumor cimac id.long_description: Bam index file for deduplicated bam file generated by the Sentieon Dedup tool (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#dedup-algorithm)

tumor cimac id.short_description: alignment: Base Qualtiy Score Recalibration (BQSR) bam file
tumor cimac id.long_description: The Sentieon QualCal (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#qualcal-algorithm) is used to perform BSQR and remove any technical artifacts in the base quality scores.

tumor cimac id.short_description: alignment: index file for Base Qualtiy Score Recalibration (BQSR) bam file
tumor cimac id.long_description: Index file for the BQSR bam file
Haplotype variants using Sentieon Haplotyper algorithm (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#haplotyper-algorithm)

tumor cimac id.short_description: germline: vcf of haplotype variants in targeted regions
tumor cimac id.long_description: Haplotype variants within targeted capture regions using Sentieon Haplotyper algorithm (https://support.sentieon.com/manual/usages/general/#haplotyper-algorithm)

tumor cimac id.short_description: hla: MHC Class I and II results (using HLA-HD)
tumor cimac id.long_description: Predicted MHC Class II and II results using the HLA-HD software (https://www.genome.med.kyoto-u.ac.jp/HLA-HD/).  Chromosome 6 reads from the deduplicated bam file were extracted and fed into the HLA-HD prediction algorithm.

tumor cimac id.short_description: hla: MHC Class I results (using OptiType)
tumor cimac id.long_description: Predicted MHC Class I alleles using the Optitype software (https://github.com/FRED-2/OptiType).  Chromosome 6 reads from the deduplicated bam file were extracted and fed into the Optitype prediction algorithm.

tumor cimac id.short_description: hla: MHC Class I and II results (using xhla)
tumor cimac id.long_description: Predicted MHC Class I and II results using the xHLA software(https://github.com/humanlongevity/HLA).  Chromosome 6 reads from the deduplicated bam file were extracted and fed into the xHLA prediction algorithm.
